intro: Nasa ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty nasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Nasa ferruginea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
